description:
Hello Bar Trekkers,

BBT6 is one of my favourite bars in Brussels (so far). It's quite small and has a real locals feel to it. It's just off Grand Place but hidden down a little side alley. So - print the map below (and make sure you zoom in close enough to see the alley way).

It's smallish size means that there's a danger we may not get seats but I suspect we will starting at 8.00 as we do. I'll also try and have a word with the landlord & try and reserve something. Fingers crossed, eh?

Again, following our normal 'it seemed like a good idea at the time' tradition we shall probably trot off for some music sometime after 10pm, quite possibly 11pm. Brasseurs de Grand Place or a Karoke bar are both quite likely :-)

No (substantial) food here to so fill up beforehand.

Here's a link to location map:
http://maps.google.co...'Imaige%20Nostre-Dame&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl

I have a new T-Shirt! - It's black with "BEER" is large friendly white lettering on it. Ideal!

See you there

Pete
name: Bar Trek 6 - A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame

description: Hello all, Brussels Bar Trek 7 will be at A Le Bacasse. This is a lovely bar squirreled down an alleyway just off grand place. Here's a link to their website: http://www.alabecasse.com/en/info.html And here's a map: http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?rls=ig&hl=en&um=1&gl=uk&resnum=1&ie=UTF-8&q=a+la+becasse+brussels&fb=1&gl=uk&hq=a+la+becasse&hnear=brussels&cid=0,0,2220567674900... As is so often the case, it's tucked down a side alley - so, print the map out (and zoom right in). Any problems - give me a call [masked]) and I'll guide you/come and get you if your close. The bar does snacky type food. So, I'd suggest getting some food before to soak up the beer (I will). As the night wears on we may find ourselves at somewhere that does music (e.g. after 10 - 10.30 ish), so let me know if you think you may come later. I've emailed them and they are saving tables for us. Very kind :-) I shall be wearing yet another t-shirt with a guitar on. This time a white t-shirt with a green guitar (and "Guildford Festival" written on it if you look a bit harder). Hope to see you there Cheers Pete
name: BBT7 - A Le Bacasse
how_to_find_us: Phone/Call me - 0471 452 934 or look out for white t-shirt with green guitar on

description:
Hi all you beer lovers,

This trek will be taking place at the very lovely Poechenellekelder (try saying that after a few Kwaks). It's full of unusual (and rather scary, I say) puppets. I find the two lifesize card playing ones particularly disturbing.

It's 5 mins from Grand Place, Just across from Manneken Pis (we can possibly sit and laugh at the tourists).

Here's some reviews of the place: http://beeradvocate.c...

And a map: http://maps.google.co...
(and as always, print it out at an appropriate zoom level unless you're sure you know the way)

I believe they only do (small?) bar snacks - so I'd fill up beforehand if I was you.

My T-Shirt will be my White with Green guitar Guildford Folk and Blues Festival T-Shirt (assuming I get it into the washer & dryer tonight :)

Standard stuff - sometime from 10.30 onwards we may well pop off to fins some music/karaoke/etc

Hope to see you there

Pete
name: BBT8 - Scary Puppets

description:
BBTer's,

After many promises I've finally got round to sorting out a BBT which involves more than just one bar.

Here's the details of the route (links to google maps - let me know if any don't work for you. I don't completely trust them :-(
The times are when we arrive at the bar named. I'll do my best to keep things on track but as beers take affect things may become more 'flexible'. What happens after the last bar is anyone's guess :-)

I'll monitor my phone also :[masked]
I'll be wearing my favourite t-shirt: Dark Blue with a White Guitar on the front.


The route:

Bar 1 (19.00): Poechenellekelder: full of unusual (and rather scary, I say) puppets. I find the two lifesize card playing ones particularly disturbing.
(Rue du Chêne 5, 1000 Bru - http://maps.google.co...)

Bar 2 (20.00) : Le Cerceuil: Love this bar! It's basically a gothic drinking den with coffins for tables. The drinks are way too pricey (approx 4 euros for a trappist beer) so we will only have the one here.
(Haringstraat 12, 1000 Bruxelles, - http://maps.google.co....

Bar 3 (20.45): Le Coq - Real local's bar. This bar will balance out the wallet-busting cost of Le Cerceuil (beers more at 3 euro mark). Being a proper bar it's a bit smokey.
(Rue Auguste Orts 14, 1000 Bruxelles - http://maps.google.co...)

Bar 4 (21.30) : Booze and Blues. This is currently my favourite Brussels bar. It's cosy and feels like a Blues bar. There's a jukebox & other odd nic-naks.
(20 rue des riches claires - http://maps.google.co...
(If google maps asks if you mean the only one it lists, just select it. I hate Google maps!)

Bar 5 (22.30): Bizon. Great bar and I expect they'll be doing music too.
(Karperbrug 7, http://maps.google.co...

My plan is too start at 7pm and move on every hour or so (except maybe less time in Cerceuil). People can join whenever they want or be with me from the start (letting me know your intentions is helpful but not essential).

First bar certainly does spag bol, etc but I think the rest don't do food. So, bear that in mind.

Be there or be somewhere else entirely! (but weep when you see the reviews of how good it was)

Pete
name: Bar Trek - Our first BBT Tour...........
how_to_find_us: Phone/Text me on 0471 452 934 - I'll be wearing my favourite t-shirt: Dark Blue with a White Guitar on the front.

description:
Hello all,

This is a slightly odd Bar Trek. I'm off to the Rock Wertcher music festival on Thursday and am hoping to meet some fellow festival goers that will be in Brussels on Weds. Obviously, a beer or two is in order. So, why not combine it with a bar trek, thought I.

I've chosen Poechenellekelder again since:
- It's easy for non-Brussels people to find (every guide book/map shows Manneken Pis)
- It has good outside seating if it's sunny but inside seating if wet
- We like it

For those that don't know it, It's full of unusual (and rather scary, I say) puppets. I find the two lifesize card playing ones particularly disturbing. It's just across from that most bizarre of tourist attractions, Manneken Pis, the small boy relieving himself.

And a map to find it:

http://maps.google.co...
(It's location"A")

(and as always, print it out at an appropriate zoom level unless you're sure you know the way)

They do bar snacks and a decent spag bol if you're more hungry.

I'll be wearing a dark blue T-Shirt with a white guitar on it. Text/call me on [masked] if you need to find me (after taking a good look at your map which you printed out). If we are inside, please note there is a downstairs area which is often easier to get a seat in. So, don't forget to look there.

Note the earlier start time due to me needing to get home at a sensible time (i.e. pre-midnight).

Also, if you're interested in the festival (4 day, camping) but missed out on a ticket. I have one spare going for face value. Let me know if you're interested (http://www.rockwercht....

Thanks

Pete
name: It's Bar Trek but not as we know it - Pre Rock Werchter (Poechenellekelde again)
how_to_find_us: Look for my T-Shirt (dark blue T-Shirt with a white guitar on it) or text/call: +32 471 452 934

description:
Hi,

I'm planning on going to the Cantillon brewery on Sat 17th July with some friends. I'd like to make it a Bar Trek outing too. It's easy to get to being on the west side of Brussels.

We will do the 'walk around by your self' tour (guided tours exist but we are a bit too thin on the ground to get the numbers. Maybe some other time given a bit more notice....)
It'll cost 5 Euros. For that you also get 2 beers to taste. If you want more after, the price per glass will be 2,00€.
(So, bring that money with you)

Here's a link to their website:
- http://www.cantillon....

Directions:
Here's a map: http://tinyurl.com/32...
So, best Metro stations are Lemonnier or Clemenceau. Then a short walk from either of them (So, print that map!)

Contact me by phone/text[masked] - we will meet at the Brewery.
I'll wear my newly purchased Black "Rock Werchter 2010" T-Shirt (which I will wash by Sat - promise :)

Depending on how we feel there may besome further beer wandering after (but I'll make all that up as I go along)

Cheers

Pete
name: Visit at Cantillon Brewery

description:
Hi all,

After a splendid tour of several bars recently we'll be doing it again on 17th July evening (somewhat after Cantillion brewery trip). It's a bit of a 'favourites' tour - so, forgive me for repetition.

Several of these bars are rather well hidden down side alleys - So, print the maps below (and make sure you zoom in close enough to see the alley way).

I think only the first one does food other than 'snacky' type food. So, you may wish to eat before or nip out for something during the evening.

Here's the plan.......

6:00pm - Mort Subite.
Very Classic bar this. Good for your Lambics!
Here's their web site:
http://www.alamortsub...

And the map:
http://maps.google.co...

7:00pm - Au Bon Vieux Temps
(Impasse St.Nicholas 4,off Rue Marché Aux Herbes 12)
Quite a small bar. Extremely quaint.
Map:
http://maps.google.co...
(Tag A)

8:00pm - A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame
(Ville Impasse des cadeaux, 3
off rue du Marché aux Herbes , 8 )
Map: http://maps.google.co...

It's quite small and has a real locals feel to it. It's just off Grand Place but hidden down a little side alley.

9:00pm - A La' Bacasse
(rue de Tabora 11)
Here's a link to their website: http://www.alabecasse...
And here's a map: http://maps.google.co...

10:00pm - Booze and Blues
(20 rue des riches claires)
This is currently my favourite Brussels bar. It's cosy and feels like a Blues bar. There's a jukebox & other odd nic-naks. Last time was here I was disappointed to find the football on. I hope for better luck this time.

Map: http://maps.google.co...
(If google maps asks, then you need to click on only item it lists, just select it. I hate Google maps!)

If we still feel able we might do some Karaoke or the Rock Classic Bar after all that. Maybe................

Look out for my T-Shirt (A Black "Rock Wertcher 2010 T-Shirt) or text/call: [masked]

Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek Tour 2
how_to_find_us: Look out for my T-Shirt (A Black "Rock Wertcher 2010 T-Shirt) or text/call: +32 471 452 934

description:
Hello all,

Last minute one this. Make it if you can while the rest of Brussels is on holiday.

Me and Clive are meeting at A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame. You are more than very welcome to join us.

A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame is one of my favourite bars in Brussels (it has a cat) It's quite small and has a real locals feel to it. It's just off Grand Place but hidden down a little side alley. So - print the map below (and make sure you zoom in close enough to see the alley way).

No (substantial) food here to so fill up beforehand.

Here's a link to location map (point A on this annoying google map):
http://tinyurl.com/3x...


My identifiable t-shirt is black with "BEER" is large friendly white lettering on it.

See you there

Pete
name: BBT Impomptu - Local wonderfulness

description:
Hi Bar Trekkers,

Our next trek take us to not merely a bar, but a beer shop (oh, and a bar :-)

Beer Mania will be our first stop. This is actually a beer shop (some 400 beers) but this need stop us having a beer or two. There's a seated area for trying the beers you've just bought and very nice it is too. The house beer is Mea Culp, which has the most decandant glass I've seen yet (see picture for this bar trek).

There's no food at Beer Mania. There's a few places to get snacks (e.g. burgers, etc) nearby but I shall be eating beforehand. You may wish to do so too.

Being a shop it closes at 21.00 (hence the 19.00 start), but fear not, since just a short minutes walk away is.......Le Grain d'Orge, which is a proper local back street bar. It's a blues bar in Ixelles but the music won't be live on a Thursday. There's food here alledgedly (chilli, spagetti, croques, etc) but I didn't spot anyone eating when I visited so I'd not state that with 100% confidence.

Here's your maps (print them and bring them):
Beer Mania [masked] Chaussee de Wavre) - 19.00 - 21.00
http://tinyurl.com/3x...


Le Grain d'Orge (142 Chaussee de Wavre) - 21.00 onwards
http://tinyurl.com/37...

Phone number is[masked] & I'll wear my Black "Brussels Summer festival" T-Shirt

Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek - Mea Culpa!

description:
All you beermiesters,

During the first weekend of September the wonderful Market Place of Brussels will again serve as the setting for the 12th edition of the Belgian Beer Weekend. My sources tell me that it gets very busy and that the best day/time to go is at the start of the Saturday session (hence 11.00am start for me). Even then we may decide that once it get's too packed me might wish to move to less frenzied areas (i.e. some bars). So phone/text me if you arive later and can't find me.

At least 50 breweries, ranging from small-, medium-sized to large Belgian breweries, participate to present you their best selections of beers.

Here's the website:
http://www.belgianbee...

It looks like we buy beer tokens (plus one for the glass deposit too!) first, then swap those for beer after (http://www.belgianbee....

I had a look last night. You can't miss it in Grand Place. There is a stall for each of the brewery's there. We shall meet by the "De Halves Mann" stall (which is inbetween "De Konick" and "Trappsten" stalls). By that I mean several steps back from it. Any problems text/phone me on[masked] 934.

I shall wear a grey t-shirt with "Rock is Dead" on.

As the website says "Beer brewed carefully, to be consumed with care" - Well, of course :-)

Cheers

Pete
name: Saturday at 12th Belgian Beer Weekend
how_to_find_us: I shall wear a grey t-shirt with "Rock is Dead" on. Chances are you'll need to text/phone me on 0471 452 934.

description:
Hello All,

This bar trek will be on a Friday in the St Catherines area (19.30 start since it's Friday). For this Bar Trek I thought we'd indulge in some music too. Three bars this time.

(42 - Rue Sainte-Catherine- http://tinyurl.com/37...)

http://www.spottedbyl...

While here you can also take the chance for some Wine and Mussels on the street at the bar just across from the Monk (if you fancy - can't stand them myself but there you go)

*** Bar 2 -[masked] - Can't remember bar name. Can't find my notes but it doesn't matter.

(6 Rue Antoine Dansaert - http://tinyurl.com/39...)

My contact number is[masked]

Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek - St Catherines area - Beer and Music - 19.30

description:
Hi,

This Bar Trek will be at one of (alledgedly 'the') oldest bars in Brussels. It's got everything! - decent beer, it does food and plenty of space (not that you'd know that looking at the entrance).

It's also close to Porte Noir (a few doors up the hill on the same road, which often does music) and a Karaoke bar in case we feel so inclined.

The bar is La Fleur en Papier Dore (Rue de Alexiens 53, about 5 mins walk from Grand Place)
- More info here: http://www.brusselspi...

And here's a link to a map: http://tinyurl.com/38...

We may move on elsewhere as and when we feel (but certainly not before 22.00)

I shall be wearing my Flaming Lips T-Shirt, which is brown with a Bear on.
Phone contact is:[masked]


Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek - La Fleur en Papier Dore

description:
I'd hoped we could do a Brussels version of the Oktoberfest. Sadly, it occurs every two years (and not this one). Are we downhearted? Never! - We'll be going to a couple of lovely bars around Merode instead.

The first is La Terrasse (1 Avenue des Celtes) -[masked]
Map: http://tinyurl.com/34...
Plenty of food here too, including Kangeroo steaks apparently. And of course, some very fine beers.

Our second little piece of beer heaven is Laristo (137 Rue de Linthout), which is about 5 min walk from La Terasse.- 21.30 onwards
Map: http://tinyurl.com/38...
Laristo is a sweet little family run cafe that just happens to do great beer too.

I shall be wearing my blue Oktoberfest T-shirt (says Oktoberfest on the back!)
Phone contact is:[masked]

I just went to visit La Terrasse. They will only reserve table space for people who are eating ('proper meals' not plates of cheese, sausage, etc). So, the new revised plan is as follows:

1) Let me know by mid-day on Weds if you would like to eat there (proper food). I'll take that number of people and get tables reserved.
2) On Weds evening, those of us not eating (which may very well be the majority) will see if there's space for us drinkers. I suspect there will be. It's Wednesday & they will have the heated outside area on the go. So, assuming all is well we all stay till 9.30 and then move on to Laristo
3) In the event that us drinking types can't get space, we'll move on to Laristo immediately. The eaters can catch us up - It's an easy and simple walk. I'll make sure there's a couple of useful maps on the go too.
4) We all get to Laristo and part-take of their rather impressive beer range.

If your plans change, please update your RSVP (We've hit my 30 person limit, so it may affect other people who want to come)

Cheers

Pete
name: (Not) Oktoberfest Brussels but some Jolly fine bars :)

description:
Hello Everybody,

I want to go to Antwerp on 23 October. Antwerp is a great city with a lot of nice bars and beers to discover.

My plan is to meet at 11:15 to take the train which leaves at 11:22 and arrives around 12:00 in Antwerp Central. Don't forget to buy a trainticket!!! You can buy a trainticker to Antwerp Central for 7.40 euro's, this ticket is called a "weekendretour". The last train back to Brussel Central at 00:03 which will arive at Brussel Central around 00:38.

Here's a map showing where Antwerp Central station is: http://www.aviewoncit...
(Useful if you come to Antwerp at a different time from me, and for when we go home)

After Arriving in Antwerp Centrel I will make a walk through the city of Antwerp, this is not a guided tour (i.e. not part of the meetup itself) but isn't it great to get to know a city on your own way? At 16:00 we will be in the first bar of the day, so if you are more interested in only the bar trek part of it the place to be is "Het elfde gebod", address Torfbrug 10 (Map here: http://tinyurl.com/38...
). We will stay for around one hour in this bar.

Here are the six bars I have inmind for teh whole trek (though, we will deide how many we actually do as we go :) These look especially worth a visit:
- Het elfde gebod (Torfbrug 10 , http://tinyurl.com/38.... : This is a fairly tourist in the centre of Antwerp and the beers are a bit pricy. But the interior will make it totally worth a visit: all walls are covered with hundreds of small statues of saints.
- De Vagant (Reyndersstraat 25, http://maps.google.co... This main reason for me to visit this bar is they have a nice cold bolleke, the local beer of Antwerp brewed by the Koninck. They also have other standard trappist beers and are specialised in jenever.
- De grote witte arend(Reyndersstraat 18, http://maps.google.co... This places looks a nice place to have a meal. They also have an own chappel, so if you suddenly feel the need to talk to god....
- Kulminator (Vleminckveld 32, http://maps.google.co...) : This is the local beer institution of Antwerp and has approximately 700 beers on offer.
- Het pakhuis (http://maps.google.co... This is a brewery pub, whit some very interesting beers to try.
- Stamineeke (Vlasmarkt 23, http://maps.google.co... This bar has Westvleteren a hard to find sixth trappist beer (though we bet it's quite expensive!).

I will wear a grey/black 'Jack Wolfskin" jacket.
You can reach me on my phone number [masked]) or Pete on his phone number [masked]).

Hope to see you on Saturday the 23 of October.

Cheers and with kind regards,
Anton
name: Bar Trek - Antwerp
how_to_find_us: Reach me on my phone number (04-85445467) or Pete's phone number (04-71452934).

description:
Hi,

It's been suggested we should do a Halloween Bar Trek (and who am I, your most humble servant, to argue).

I went for quite a long wander on Weds evening in an attempt totrack down likely Sunday Halloween venues. Not a lot jumped out at me (most bars are doing it on the Sat). However, the nice lady in Le Cercuil assured me that plenty of places will be open and doin' the Halloween thing. So, no problem!

So, I've decided that we will make it up as we go to some extent. But we will start at:

Le Cerceuil (Haringstraat 12, 1000 Bruxelles, just off grand place ): http://tinyurl.com/3x...

I love this bar! It's basically a gothic drinking den with coffins for tables. The drinks are abit too pricey (approx 4 euros for a trappist beer) so we will not stay here all nigth (unless we really really like it).

The bar maid told me that last year they didn't close till about 6am :)
We'll stay here at least 1 1/2 hours (till 21.00)

We'll decide on the next bar(s) based on some, in situ, checking that I'll do on Sunday evening (I'll pop off for a few minutes round some of my favourites, then report back). We won't go far and likely suspects are:

- Poechenellekelder
- A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame
- Au Bon Vieux Temps
- Les Brasseurs de la Grand Place
- Delirium

I'll be wearing a suitably spooky black shirt covered with skulls, daggers & the like. If you get lost or turn up after 9.00 give me a call/text on[masked] and I'll guide you/tell you where we are.

Scarey Cheers

Pete

P.s. Le Cercuil is very dark when you first enter. There's also a step just when you get to the main bar bit, so don't trip over it!
name: Bar trek - Spirits!
how_to_find_us: Look for me in a black shirt covered with skulls, daggers & the like. Or give me a call/text on 0471 452 934

description:
Hi all,

Our nest outing will be to Bier Circus. It's an easy walk from City Centre (near Madou)

Website here:
http://www.bier-circu...

Map Here (Onderrichtsstraat 89):
http://maps.google.co...

They use to do a great deal more food (cooked with beer) but I think they found it more profitable to concentrate on beer. So, not so much food range as there once was. a full list of the food they do on the website. However, they have a startlingly impressive beer range.

They do good food (incuding a rather nice Spag Bol made with Chimey). There's As a result, I'll be eating there You may wish to do the same (if you know you will it would be helpful to let me know so I can give the owners a feel for the number of people that may be
eating)

Not sure there's much close to move onto - any suggestions are welcome. But if we end up there all evening it wouldn't be a bad thing anyway.

I'm trying my new mobile number [masked])
(if that goes horribly wrong - use the old one:[masked])

I think I'll wear my colourful shirt with fish on it. Why not, eh?


Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek - Bier Circus
how_to_find_us: Use map and phone/text me on 0488 658 612 or 0471 452 934

description:
The Westvleteren Brewery is the smallest of the six trappist beer producers and the beer is extremely (!) hard to get hold of. The Monks only sell a limited amount to individuals and take license plate numbers of the cars for those people.

After extensive phone attempts, etc no-one was able to get through and book a slot to pick up crates of beers. However, we shall go anyway - there's the visitors centre (not sure how big) and we can (alledgedly) by 6 bottles per person from the Cafe.

The website link is here: http://www.sintsixtus...

I reckon it'sabout a 1hr 30 mins drive (?) so we'll meet at 12.00 to give us time to sort ourselves out and allow for any delay. The visitor bit opens at 2.00. Not sure about the cafe.

We shall meet at Delta Metro car park. For those coming by metro:
- get off the Metro at Delta (on the Yellow/orange colour line 5, towards Hermann-Debroux if coming from city centre direction)
- go up the escalator & exit that bit
- Find "exit 1" and go that way. You'll find yourself going down a short tunnel
- Go up escaltor at end. We'll meet her (subject to dodging cars, etc)

Apologies to those who wanted to come but we didn't have enough car seats for. We'll report back and most likely arrange somethign else sometime.

Cheers

Pete

Some links:
http://en.wikipedia.o...
http://www.sintsixtus...
name: Westvleteren Brewery - Getting hold of "that" Beer

description:
Hello all,

After a very successful improptu visit to Le Corbeau last Sat I'll now schedule a proper meetup there.

Le Corbreau (The Raven) is a rather remarkable place where dancing on the tabletops at weekends is not only acceptable, but positively encouraged! It all seemed to kick off around 11.45 when I was there. Music varied from 80/90s classics to more standard 'dance' as the night went on.

Take a look here - www.lecorbeau.be/

Before we get there (sometime after 9.00, probably 9.30ish) we shall meet at Les Postiers, which is close by. The tricky bit will be to get table space at Le Corbeau, so I may nip off and do a quick reccy at 9ish.

Both have very fine beer selections (as we would hope :)

Here's the maps:

Le Postiers (20.00 - 21.00+) - 14 Rue du Fosse aux Loups
http://tinyurl.com/2w...

Le Corbeau - (21.00+ till we fall off the tables)
http://tinyurl.com/2u...

Meet there. I shall be wearing a Psychedelic (many bright coloured) Shirt - Hard to describe really, but I promise you'll know when you see it! And/Or phone/text me on[masked]

Pete
name: Dancing on Tables!  - Les Postiers and Le Corbeau

description:
Merry Chrimbo all,

For the year's last Bar Trek we shall get into the Yuletide spirit!

The Christmas market at St Catherines has a lot of food and drink stalls (as well as plenty of xmas pressie type stalls). There's also an ice rink and big wheel for those who are inclined (I am ! :). We'll start quite early (19.00) to allow for tourist avoidance strategies, but feel free to turn up any time before (or after!) 21.00.

It'll be quite a free form event. I'll designate a meeting point that I'll be at once an hour till 21.00 (when it closes). I'll wait there for 5 mins (only). Then those that wish can stroll with me around the stalls. Otherwise, you stroll by yourself until we catch up with each other (which may be a while if I've taken the plunge for the ice skating)

Of course, if you want to wander by yourself or in small sub-groups that's just what's intended. The meeting point is:

The Timmermans stall, near the information point (near the top of the escalator exits from the Metro).


Phone me if you have any problem finding me (which you can do if you miss me at the 'On The Hour' meeting time too).

I took some photos, including pictures of the Timmermans stall. Album here:
http://www.meetup.com...

Here's some details of the Market: http://www.christmasm...

And a map: http://tinyurl.com/35...

From 21.00 we'll get into proper Bar Trek mode and go to a bar very close to St Catherines, Madame Moustache (Quai au Bois à Brûler 5-7). Details here: http://www.madamemous...
And a map: http://tinyurl.com/2w...

Find me at Timmermans stall on the Hour (or call[masked]). I'll wear a sweatshirt with a fantasy type helmet on the front (and dragon on the back but covered by my a leather jacket and probably a black wolly hat, since I expect it will be jolly cold!)

BTW - If you need warming up or it rains, head straight for Madame Moustache.

Bah Humbug!

Pete
name: Bar Trek - St Catherines Christmas Market

description:
Aperos Urbains is an outdoor event held on Friday evenings throughout summer, which rotates around different locations in Brussels each week. They have DJs, bars and food vendors. Usually a nice way to kick off the weekend. There's a special Aperos Urbains organised during "La fete de l'Iris", but the 1st Friday event is on 27th May.

http://www.cityplug.be/fr/pages/partenaires/34_Aperos-Urbains-2011.html

I'm afraid I could only find a link in French, it didn't work in English :-(

The event kicks off at 5.30pm, but I can only be there from 7pm. If someone can go earlier, can you let me know - we can organise this together.

We meet around the (right hand side of the) bar at 7pm, and I will wait there till 7.20pm. For those who have confirmed they are coming, I will email my mobile no. the day before.

If you have trouble finding us (or after 7.20) Call/Text Simona or me (Pete ﻿[masked], though I only ﻿gaureentee I'll answer till 8.30 due to beer related reasons :). Also, it'll be loud so texting is probably a good option - I'll check my phone every 15 mins (till 8.30)

See you there!

Simona
how_to_find_us: Phone Simona or for last minute attendees me (Pete - 0488 658 612) (but after 8.30 ish no gaureentees I'll answer!)
name: Aperos Urbains 2011

description:
﻿Our multi-bar trek will consist of 4 bars

http://www.churchills.be/home/

Cheers

Pete

description:
Greeting fellow imbibers,

Next Weekend (Sept 2-4th) is the Brussels Beer Festival in Grand Place. Clearly, Bar Trek needs a presence - We shall go there on Saturday (3rd). It takes up the whole of Grand Place, so you can't miss it

Here's the home page for the fest: http://www.weekenddelabiere.be/en/pages/home.htm

It gets very busy and that the best day/time to go is at the start of the Saturday session (hence 11.00am start for me).

Last year some of us stayed till 18.00ish and it was just tooooo packed to move. So, this year we'll stay till 15.00 ish and then review things - I suspect, if still standing, the professional drinkers will move elsewhere (nearby but not so close that we run into other fest escapees)

We buy beer tokens (plus one for the glass deposit too!) first, then swap those for beer after, You have to queue for those separately, so it's wise to allow time for that prior to drinking time

Clearly, meeting up will be tricky. I'll keep an eye/ear out for calls and texts [masked]), though is the day wears on I expect my efficiency to decrease :)

We shall aim to meet at the bottom LHS (facing down Grand Place) & just try to get together as best we can. See attached map (based on last years set up - if they've changed it all then just approximate as best you can), I shall be wearing my Red "Bar Trek" T-Shirt (it's very red)

If it's very wet, then I may Cancel - so keep an eye on this page - I'll put an update here Thurs & Friday.

As the website says "Beer brewed carefully, to be consumed with care" - Well, of course :-)

Cheers Pete

The Map:
how_to_find_us: I shall my red 'Bar Trek' t-shirt. Chances are you'll need to text/phone me on 0488 658 612, Look at map below for meeting point

Hi,

It's that time of year for a Halloween Bar Trek.

We shall begin in Porte Noir (not that spooky but underground and a great beer selection). We shall move on to the main venue (Le Cercuil) at 21:15 or thereabouts. (Feel free just to meet us at Le Cercuil). Who knows what we may do towards the end of the evening.

The Bars:
- 19:30-21:15: Porte Noir (67, rue des Alexiens,1000 Brussels) - Great bar. Just go down the spiral stone steps and get a beer. Website is here: http://www.laportenoire.be/?&lang=en. Map here: ﻿http://tinyurl.com/6dj4qsv

- 21:30 onwards: Le Cerceuil (Haringstraat 12, 1000 Bruxelles, down a side alley, just off grand place ): Map Here: http://tinyurl.com/3xo5aj8 
I love this bar! It's basically a gothic drinking den with coffins for tables and music to match. The drinks can be a bit pricey (approx 4.20 euros for a trappist beer) Le Cercuil is very dark when you first enter. There's also a step just when you get to the main bar bit, so don't trip over it!

Don't forget to print a map (and at a scale that allows you to locate the bar(s)

I'll be wearing a suitably nasty Snow White and the Seven Dwarves T-Shirt (feel free to make yourself Halloween-esk or not as you wish)

If you get lost give me a call/text on ﻿and I'll guide you/tell you where we are

Scary Cheers

Pete

Hello Bar Trekkers,

For this little quaffing session I've chosen somewhere with a bit of class (and fantastic drinking selection) - Belladore in St Giles. It's quite a small bar, tastefully decorated and playing music aimed to allow easy conversation. Here's their website (lots of piccies) - http://www.labelladone.com/index.html. It's in French/Flemish.

To get there it's about a 15 min walk from Louise Metro, or just take the 97 tram (four stops in the "Dieweg" direction) which will deposit you right outside (the stop is "Janson"). The address is Rue Moris 17A - 1060 Bruxelles.
And here's map:http://tinyurl.com/76phnku

In addition to a more than reasonable beer list, they also have 30+ vodkas, 24 rums, non-trivial white & red wine lists and cocktails including some hot ones such as tea with Romanian rum. Great stuff! I tried a vodka and a tea cocktail - both very nice if pricey - 6 or 7 euro for vodka, similar for hot cocktails (Errr…...I think - it was getting a bit blurry by then :)

No food other than normal bar snacks (cheese, sausage slices, etc) so eat before you come.

Bar man was very friendly and helpful, and has booked some space for us (only 25, I'm afraid - if this Trek goes well I'll repeat it at some point)

The space is more limited here than our usual treks, so please be accurate with your RSVPs - a "Yes" really needs mean your coming, otherwise someone else will be missing out on all that lovely silly juice. I've set the Meetup to have an automatic waiting list, so if you find you plans change please update your RSVP. Also, I'll probably close the Trek to RSVP on Weds night.

I shall be easily identifiable ﻿in a green shirt with turtles on 

Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: Use the map or take No 97 Tram to "Janson" - Phone/text me on 0488 658 612 - I'll be wearing a green shirt covered in turtles
name: Bar Trek - A bit of Class (and Vodka) - Belladore

description: Hi All - Pete is away this weekend, but as it's my birthday coming up, he's kindly let me borrow his meetup group. I'm going out to dinner at Kokob (this is another gathering that happened to be organised at the same time - Joey Cheeks told me about it), and then afterwards I'll be heading over to Le Corbeau for some 'dancing' (unless anyone has a better suggestion). I've put 10pm provisionally but we may well arrive at Le Corbeau somewhat later - there's no rush as the place is open 'until dawn'.  You're all welcome to come along! - Colin
name: Colin's birthday party

description:
Merry Chrimbo all, Time to get into the Yuletide spirit!

The Christmas market at St Catherines has a lot of food and drink stalls (as well as plenty of xmas pressie type stalls). There's also an ice rink and big wheel for those who are inclined.

We'll start quite early (19.00) to allow for tourist avoidance strategies, but feel free to turn up any time before (or after!) 21.00.

It'll be quite a free form event. Our 'general' meeting point will be the Moeder Lambic stall at the market. I'll be at once an hour till 21.00. I only guarantee to wait there for 5 mins though in reality I will often hang around there at other times. There are several other stalls, etc that are of beer interest too. Of course, you can stroll by yourself until we catch up with each other or by yourself or in small sub-groups as desired.

The meeting point is Moeder Lambic, which is near the top end of the market, in the right hand side of the stalls ,looking at St Caterines Church thingy. It next to a large heavy iron wheel (laying horizontally, not standing up) and also a British food stand (whatever that turns out to really be :)

I've uploaded some picture here:http://www.meetup.com/The-Brussels-Bar-Trek/files/

Phone me if you have any problem finding me (which you can do if you miss me at the 'On The Hour' meeting time too).

I took some photos last year. Album here: http://www.meetup.com/The-Brussels-Bar-Trek/photos/1178053/

Here's some details of the Xmas Market: http://www.christmasmarkets.com/Belgium/brussels-christmas-market.html
There's plenty of food and drink of many types (plenty of hot mulled wine with added spirits - yum!)

And a map: http://tinyurl.com/35yadxb From 21.00 we'll get into proper Bar Trek mode and go to a bar very close to St Catherines, The Monk (42 - Rue Sainte-Catherine- Map: http://tinyurl.com/37owz3v , Details http://www.spottedbylocals.com/brussels/monk). It's big so there should be plenty of space. Having said that, if we're getting there quite late who knows what seating availability may be like - We just take our chances, eh?

Find me at Moeder Lambic on the Hour (19.00, 20.00, 21.00) (or call[masked]). I'll wear a white sweatshirt thingy with cute Pandas on (well, except that they are carrying a pistol - Good will to all non-panda's & all that!) but somewhat covered by my a leather jacket and possibly a black woolly hat, since I expect it will be jolly cold!

BTW - If you need warming up or it rains, head straight for The Monk.

Bah Humbug!

Pete

p.s. As a special guest star we will have my friend Chris from the UK, who was one of the three initial Meetup Organisers from our London based Pub Tours group, from which Bar Trek was born........
name: Bar Trek - St Catherines Christmas Market and The Monk

description:
OK, We've done this before and liked it a lot!

Le Corbreau (The Raven) is a rather remarkable place where dancing on the tabletops at weekends is not only acceptable, but positively encouraged! It all seemed to kick off around 11.45 when I was there. Music varied from 80/90s classics to more standard 'dance' as the night went on.

Take a look here - www.lecorbeau.be/

Map (since I don't fully trust the Meetup ones): </a><a href="http://tinyurl.com/2urrect" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://tinyurl.com/2urrect" target="_blank"></a><a href="http://tinyurl.com/2urrect" target="_blank">http://tinyurl.com/2urrect

It does good beer - in very tall 'Kwak'-like glasses (before the dancing gets underway). If I recall, it may do food earlier on but I wouldn't count on it. I'll be eating before I get there.

We shall meet there (print that map!). Phone/text me on[masked]

Be aware that the bar get's filled up quickly and it's pretty much impossible to book/save seats. So, it's up to you to get there early enough if you want to sit down. I went to try and book a table. Unless I could gaurentee X people by Y time, all eating they wouldn't let me. So, I repeat....get there early if you want a seat

As always, no thanks whatsoever to Meetup.com for taking away the 'RSVP' Maybe option - so if you can indicate you level of likelyhood of being there, please do.

For identification purposes, I shall be wearing a something identifiable - Black shirt with a Gold dragon on
Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: We shall meet there (print that map!). I shall be wearing a black shirt with a gold dragon on - And/Or phone/text me on 0488 658 612
name: Dancing on Tables! - Le Corbeau

description:
Hi,

I decided I fancy a beer tomorrow (Sat) evening, so why not a Bar Trek............

For this bar trek it's back to the spooky bar........

Le Cerceuil (Haringstraat 12, 1000 Bruxelles, just off grand place ): http://tinyurl.com/3xo5aj8

I love this bar! It's basically a gothic drinking den with coffins for tables.

We'll stay here at least 2 hours (till 22.00) and may decide to look in somewhere else near. We'll decide where on the evening. Maybe the Rock Classic Bar or maybe some of the smaller ones nearby (e.g. Bon Veux Temps or Image Nostre Dame ﻿, both off Rue Marche Aux Herbs)

BTW - Since this is last minute I haven't booked any table/seating so it's taking a chance it won't be too full. should be OK but be warned some last minute crisis management may occur if required . Any Problems - phone/text[masked]

I'll be wearing either a T-Shirt with a Red Dragon on or a sweatshirt with a Red﻿ Dragon on (if cold :)

Scarey Cheers

Pete

P.s. Le Cercuil is very dark when you first enter. There's also a step just when you get to the main bar bit, so don't trip over it!
how_to_find_us: Find me in the bar - any problems phone/text 0488 658 612 - Look for my Red Dragon T/Sweat shirt
name: Last Minute Bar trek - Le Cercuil!

description:
Greetings Trekkers, 

Now that the minus 10 temperatures have receded it's time for the first multi-bar Bar Trek of the year. Feel free to join at any point (but if you're late we will have moved on - probably)
I did a recon on Weds night. Here's the Plan (there's a little slack time between venues - longest actual walk is 5 mins):


[masked]: Moeder Lambic (the one in centre not St Giles): Excellent beer range. Friendly staff. Will be busy
Address is: Place Fontainas 8, Brussels, Belgium 1000 (Map Here: http://tinyurl.com/7rvwplj)

 

21.15 - 22.15- Booze N Blues: It's cosy and feels like a Blues bar. There's a jukebox & other odd nic-naks. Map: http://tinyurl.com/3exkfrv

(Booze N Blues is quite small. If it's bust we will use the Java bar as a 'spill over' venue. The Java bar is directly (diagonally) across from Booze N Blues. Beers not as good but they do have a wacky bar top surface!)

22.30 - 23.30: Le Coq: Very traditional locals bar. Map: http://tinyurl.com/3q46gnw

23.45 onwards: Monk: A good, no nonsense bar this. Plenty of space and some cracking beers. Map: http://tinyurl.com/37owz3v

After that who knows…….

This could be a bit of bun fight. I haven't booked any table space - I asked at Moeder Lambic but they said there's no table booking on a Sat. So, we just need to take places as we find them. Seats are not guaranteed. I'll be sticking pretty strictly to the timetable, so be ready to move on time. Beer waits for no man (or women)!

For identification purposes I shall wear my Red 'Bar Trek' T-Shirt

In the event of rain you will probably get wet

If your plans change - please update your RSVP

Cheers


Pete
how_to_find_us: Print the maps and text/phone me if you can't find us - 0488 658 612
name: Bar Trek Tour - Central Brussels

description:
Hello all,

For our next trip we will try something that doesn't just involve beer!
(It took quite some persuading to get me to think about something so odd - You can thank Angie for the suggestion)

We shall try an outing to Restobieres. Basically, it's a restaurant where much of the food is cooked with beer, & accompanied by beer.

Web site: http://www.restobieres.eu/index.php/en/Accueil
Here's map: http: //tinyurl.com/7hcccug

We shall meet there at 20.00. When I say 20:00 I mean that in the British sense of actually meeting at 20.00, not (for example) 20.30.

I'm keeping the number of invites low for this first visit (just 10) and that's what we've booked table space for. If all goes well, we shall repeat……

So, please do not sign up unless you are 100% certain of coming (I'll be watching  )

There are 'all in' menus that look good value. Very Important -'all in' excludes beer (and possibly coffee, etc for the misguided souls that want that :). And probably something else too.

I uploaded the menu (French & Flemish - go to http://www.meetup.com/The-Brussels-Bar-Trek/files/ ﻿). Apparently the price is now 19 Euros (but who knows!). There's other menu's too. Basically, you are responsible for working out what you want, adding it up and paying for it. The 19 Euro menu is my aim but I suppose it's up to you......

After that (whenever 'that' is) there's a better than average chance we (those that wish to) will move on to a nice bar or two (maybe Porte Noir?)

Any problems, etc – Phone[masked]
(That's a change of mobile number for people that know me)

Thanks

Pete
name: Bar Trek - Beer and Food (but mostly beer) - Restobieres

description:
Hi all,

﻿Au Bon Vieux Temps - A truly lovey little bar.

I've avoided having Bar Treks here before since it's not that big. However, I had a word with one of the bar maids and she says we can book space - so, we'll give it a try.

Here's some details and good piccies: http://www.cromwell-intl.com/travel/belgium/belgian-beers/au-bon-vieux-temps.html

And here's a map: http://tinyurl.com/6lzj3at

It's just off Grand Place, but tucked down a little alley off Rue de March Aux Herbes. Phone if you can't find it (but look first :) -[masked]

Note that the phone number is a new one from previous Bar Treks

I expect we'll move on at some point (not before 22.00). We'll decide where on the night.

For identification purposes I shall wear a  T-Shirt (Black with BEER written in large friendly white letters)

Cheers

Pete
name: Bar Trek - Au Bon Vieux Temps

description:
Trekkers,

For this Bar Trek we shall be going further afield - to the Zythos Beer Festival (near Leuven). 300 beers!

The beer fest website is here: http://www.zbf.be/index.php?lang=UK&page=1

It runs from 12:00 on Saturday 28th April and in true Bar Trek fashion that's what we will be aiming for (well, almost)

There's snacks available (chips (fries), dörum, hamburgers) so we can keep nicely fed.

The meeting point will be at the beer festival itself. It's at "The Brabanthal" which we can get to using shuttle buses from Leuven Station. I'm assuming they will be easily identifiable.

I will be getting the 11.40 train from Brussels Central station (arriving Leuven 12.03). I encourage you to join me but of course you may travel at any time, in any manner you wish. Don't forget to allow for time to buy your ticket (not sure how much it costs). If you want to join me on the train - don't be late!
Meet me on the platform the train goes from (whatever platform that turns out to be) at the end nearest the front of the train.

In fact, when RSVPing 'Yes' if you geuss your likely turn up time that would be helpful (though not necessary)

I shall wear my new blue Bar Trek T-Shirt (it has "Bar Trek" written on it) and phone/text me [masked]).

No idea how long we'll stay - till 16:00 at least and possibly far longer (but no guarantees past 16:00)

Also, there's no easy way to work out a good meeting point at the festival. So, you may just need to phone/text me [masked]). As an initial guess, I'll say somewhere near the Tombola stand
(http://www.zbf.be/index.php?lang=UK&page=1c). But who knows!


Cost:
Free entry (hooray!)
Beer: 1.40 euro per 15cl (paid via tokens)
Beer Glass: 3 euro (returnable deposit)
Toilet: 0.30 euro per visit (could get expensive :)
Festival guide: 0.50 euro

See you there

Pete
how_to_find_us: Meet at BRX Central Train Station or Fest (Tombola stand???) - look for Blue Bar Trek T-Shirt - or phone/text me (0486 751 377)
name: Zythos Beer Festival - just outside Leuven

description:
Hi All,

Time for a favourite venue - The Monk!

(42 - Rue Sainte-Catherine- Map: http://tinyurl.com/37owz3v)

A good, no nonsense bar this. Plenty of space and some cracking beers. Having said that - it'll be Friday so who knows how easily we will find spots to sit in. I'm not expecting problems, but we shall see.....

No food here but places nearby if you're peckish

If we're in the mood we may move on somewhere later (but not till 22.00 at the earliest and probably later than that)

My mobile number will be:[masked] - Give me a shout on that if you're lost (after checking your map that you printed out, didn't you?........) or can't see us in the bar.

description:
Hot on the heels of our recent trip to a Beer Festival in Leuven, we are once again stretching our beer legs. We're off to Antwerp!

Caveats:
We did this trek some time ago (thanks to Anton for organising that) so, in theory, we have some idea what we're about now (maybe). On thing we did find last time is that sometimes our bars of choice where closed or only open for foodies. So, while I hope to run this trek on a tight schedule, be prepared for emergency planning (so, keep a printed map and my phone number close)

Also, we will be hitting the bars at the weekend, during peak times. So, getting a seat will not always be an option.

The walk to/from T 'Pakhuis is 20+ mins. Well worth it but I'm assuming reasonable weather. If its raining then I may skip it completely.

I considered the T 'Pakhuis brewery tour but I think the minimum requirement of 15 people will go against us. However, I think that may be a future Bar Trek………….


We will find food as and when, in whatever form appeals – so speak up if you're feeling peckish!

Getting there and Back:
The plan is to catch the 12.22 train from Brussels Central Station. This arrives 12.58 in Antwerp. I shall meet others catching that train on the platform (near to the end of the front of the train).

Don't forget to buy a train ticket!!! You can do it on-line here: http://www.b-rail.be/nat/E/ Or at the station. I did mine via internet and printed the ticket it emailed me.
Get a "Weekend Ticket" (not a "Standard Ticket") it's 7.80 euros
(from Brussels Central to Antwerp Central (return)).

The last train back to Brussel Central at 00:02 which will arrive at Brussel Central around 00:38. Don't miss it! – next train is 05.11! Of course, you can meander back whenever you wish

Anyone who wants to catch us later in day – feel free. Print maps & phone me to check where we are [masked])

The Plan:
In a major step forward in Bar Trek technology I've created a single map with all the pubs on. It has all the bars on, including walking directions and timings between bars! Here it is (but I may vary the route once back in centre of town)

 - http://tinyurl.com/cez2lzp

The planned schedule is as follows:

Apart from the start the timings are only approximate. There's a better than average chance some bars may be too packed to be worth bothering. Others may be worth hanging about in for a bit longer. So, if your joining after the first bar – phone/text me (we could be anywhere). My mobile number is[masked] 377.

I'll be wearing my Blue 'Bar Trek T-Shirt (though a jacket too if it's chilly)

As always – Print all the details and maps. Critical in this case since I don’t know Antwerp – I can't direct anyone by phone!

There's a metro type thing but I don't plan to use that. 7.3 km – who says beer doesn't keep you fit


12.22: Train from Brussels Central Station
12.58 Arrive Antwerp Central station
• (<a>http://www.aviewoncities.com/antwerp/centralstation.htm)
</a>• BTW – Antwerp Station is actually rather nice. Well worth a few minutes having a wander around

13:30: (possibly quite accurate )
't Oud Arsenaal: Maria Pijpelincxstraat 4. 2000 Antwerpen.

- http://tinyurl.com/bunp7ge

• Small, dark and cosy – Don't expect to be sitting down in this one


15:00 (very approx)
Het pakhuis : Vlaamse Kaai 76, 2000 Antwerpen.
• (http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=antwerp%20Het%20pakhuis%20vlaamsekaai%2076&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl):):
• This is a brewery pub. I've tried the beers – I liked them (May skip this pub if weather is against us)
• <a>http://www.huisbrouwerijpakhuis.be
</a>

From here on I have various bars in mind but which ones we go to and how long we stay is variable. Base plan is:

Stamineeke : Vlasmarkt 23, Antwerp

- https://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=antwerp+Stamineeke&ie=UTF-8
• Stamineeke is the one true specialist beer café. It's a two-storey affair, in another 17th century house in the Antwerp style.. This bar has Westvleteren a hard to find sixth trappist beer (though we bet it's quite expensive!).

- Google maps is being a pain with this map. It's just down the road from De Vagant (next bar)


De Vagant: Reyndersstraat 25, Antwerp
• http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=De%20Vagant%20antwerp&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl): • This is (alledgely) one of the best jenever bars in the world – we shall see……


De grote witte arend: Reyndersstraat 18, 2000 Antwerpen
• http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=antwerp%20De%20grote%20witte%20arend&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl):
• Apparently they have their own chapel – make of that what you will
• <a>http://www.degrootewittearend.be/
</a>

Pater's Vaetje: Blauwmoezelstraat 1, 2000 Antwerpen.
• https://maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&q=%E2%80%A2%09Pater's+Vaetje:+Blauwmoezelstraat+1,+2000+Antwerpen&ie=UTF-8
• A rather pretty drinking venue right next to the cathedral (apparently). If we get pushed for time this is one that may be dropped.
• <a>http://www.patersvaetje.be/bieren
</a>

Kulminator :
• Vleminckveld 32, 2000 Antwerpen
• http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=antwerp%20Kulminator&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl) :
• This is the local beer institution of Antwerp and has approximately 700 beers on offer (some damn expensive! - so check prices before ordering).

And from this point……Who knows. At some point we go home (most likely at quite different times)

Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: Meet at BRX Station, or in Anterp: Print Map! and phone/text 0486 751 377 - Look for Blue 'Bar Trek' T-Shirt
name: Bar Trek - Antwerp Revisited

description:
Hello Trekkers,

Apologies for lack of Trekking recently. Been a tad busy.

Our next trek is to a favourite little bar of mine - The Cobra Bar (1 Rue des Chartreux). It's near the centre of town (just up from the Greenwich)
(Map: https://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=1+Rue+des+Chartreux+brussels&ie=UTF-8&hq=&hnear=0x47c3c387ec37bbbf:0x5b88eb671d27024f,Rue+des+Chartreux+1,+1000+Bruxelles,+Belgium&gl=uk&ei=qJgPUJvJNYSJhQewuoDYAw&ved=0CAYQ8gEwAA)

We've space reserved - but only for 25 people. That's really only 25 people (health and safety type stuff), so please only come if you've signed up. And only sign up if you intend to come (and update your RSVP if your plans change).

We shall be in the upstairs bit. I plan to stay from 20.00 till approx 22.00 and then (possibly) move on for a bit of variety. Maybe to Booze and Blues (Rue des Riches Claires 20: https://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&q=Rue+des+Riches+Claires+20,+Bruxelles,+Belgique&ie=UTF-8&hq=&hnear=0x47c3c478183c179f:0x96e82c511096a1f9,Rue+des+Riches+Claires+20,+1000+Bruxelles,+Belgium&gl=uk&ei=oL8PUJa2M9CShgfU94HAAg&ved=0CAYQ8gEwAA )

As always, if you can't find us - phone/text[masked]

My identifiable garment for this trek is a mostly blue short with a sort of nursery rhyme theme. Cow jumping over the moon, etc. Though there's other things like frogs & fish doing that too - so, more a sort of drug induced childs nightmare really.

Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: Meet in top bit - If lost phone/text 0486 751 377
name: Bar Trek - Cobra!

description:
Greetings Trekkers,

On next trek shall be, unusually, a Weds evening visitation.

You may wonder why Wedenesday (relatively unusual for us)? Meetup ran some sort of competition where someone could win a trip to anywhere in the World. Someone won and chose Brussels and Bar Trek (well, more some of the running in Brussels possibly, but we'll take any positive waves we can get, eh?). So, we'd better all be on best behaviour (yea, right :)

We'll try and do a few bars (while, no doubt, imparting far more info about our own personal favourites too)

Being completely partisan in these matters, we'll go to bars I like the best :)

The plan is:
*[masked]: Moeder Lambic (the one in centre of Brussels NOT in St Giles): Excellent beer range. Friendly staff.
Address is: Place Fontainas 8, Brussels, Belgium 1000 (Map Here: http://tinyurl.com/7rvwplj)

description:
Greeting fellow imbibers,

Next Weekend is the Brussels Beer Festival in Grand Place. Clearly, Bar Trek needs a presence - We shall go there on Saturday (1st). It takes up the whole of Grand Place, so you can't miss it

Here's the home page for the fest: http://www.weekenddelabiere.be/en/pages/home.htm

It gets very busy and that the best time to go is at the start of the session (hence 11.00am start for me).

In previous years some of us stayed till 18.00ish and it was just tooooo packed to move. So, this year we'll stay till 15.00 ish and then review things - I suspect, if still standing, the professional drinkers will move elsewhere (nearby but not so close that we run into other fest escapees)

We buy beer tokens (plus one for the glass deposit too!) first, then swap those for beer after, You have to queue for those separately, so it's wise to allow time for that prior to drinking time

Clearly, meeting up will be tricky. I'll keep an eye/ear out for calls and texts [masked]), though is the day wears on I expect my efficiency to decrease :)

We shall aim to meet at the bottom LHS (facing down Grand Place) & just try to get together as best we can. See attached map (based on last years set up - if they've changed it all then just approximate as best you can), I shall be wearing my black and white, dancing man waistcoat

I had a look at the weather forecast. Apparently it will be dry even if it's wet on Friday. Well, fingers crossed then, eh?

Also, Brian Dunhill who runs another beer group is there on Friday evening. Details here if you fancy that: www.facebook.com/groups/[masked]/

<a href="https://www.gmx.com/dereferrer/?target=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fgroups%2F226189960803899%2F&lang=en" target="_blank"></a>As the website says "Beer brewed carefully, to be consumed with care" - Well, of course :-)

Cheers Pete

The Map:
how_to_find_us: I shall my black and white, dancing man waistcoat. Chances are you'll need to text/phone me on 0486 751 377, Look at map below for meeting point
name: Saturday at Brussels Beer Fest in Grand Place

description:

Bar Trek returns to a favourite - La Fleur en Papier Dore. This is one of the (alledgedly 'the') oldest bars in Brussels. It's got everything! - decent beer, it does food and plenty of space (not that you'd know that looking at the entrance).

It's also close to the very fine Porte Noir (a few doors up the hill on the same road, which often does music) which I plan to move onto at about 22:00 (but that's very flexable). Porte Noir has an excellent range of beers, many on tap.

The bar is La Fleur en Papier Dore (Rue de Alexiens 53, about 5 mins walk from Grand Place)
- More info here: http://www.brusselspi...

Cheers

description:
Hi,

It's that time of year for a Halloween Bar Trek. This year I intend it to have a Rock music slant too :)

The main, venue will be Le Cerceuil (Haringstraat 12, 1000 Bruxelles, down a side alley, just off grand place ): Map Here: http://tinyurl.com/3xo5aj8

This bar is basically a gothic drinking den with coffins for tables and music to match. The drinks can be a bit pricey (approx 4.20 euros for a trappist beer) Le Cercuil is very dark when you first enter. There's also a step just when you get to the main bar bit, so don't trip over it!

I'm not planning on reserving space since we get the back room & we really want to be in the main bar. So, it may be a bit of a bun fight with limited seats.

We'll stay here till 22.00 at least and quite possible later.

Our final destination will be the Rock Classic bar (Rue du Marché au Charbon[masked] Brussels, Belgium – Map: http://tinyurl.com/6xa4nstl). This bar is open till 6.00 in the morning!

It has two bars – one is ear bleeding nasty rock, the other far more eardrum friendly classic rock (70-90's sort of thing). Bizarrely, and I really can't express how much this annoys me, you can only drink shite beer or cocktails in the Classic Bar – even though you just walk between them & they use the same bar staff. Crazy!

I may or may not insert a bar in between the Cerceuil and Rock Classic depending on how I/everyone feels & how busy paces are (I'll run out & take a look )

Don't forget to print a map (and at a scale that allows you to locate the bar(s)). And don't trust the Meetup provided maps - use my links above.

I'll be wearing a suitably nasty Shirt – A red fire devil demon type thingy. I also will have a (rather small) flashing scary pumpkin head (printed from my 3D printer)

If you get lost give me a call/text on[masked] and I'll guide you/tell you where we are (Standard caveat that, as the evening wears on, I'll be less likely/able to hear my phone or indeed talk on it)

Scary Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: Meet in Le Cercuil - I will be wearing Red Fire Demon Shirt. If lost give me a call/text on 0486 751 377
name: Bar Trek - Rock Trek or Treat!

description:
Merry Chrimbo all, Time to get into the Yuletide spirit!

The Christmas market at St Catherines has a lot of food and drink stalls (as well as plenty of xmas pressie type stalls). There's also an ice rink and big wheel for those who are inclined.

We'll start quite early (19.00) to allow for tourist avoidance strategies, but feel free to turn up any time before (or after!) 21.00. If you have trouboe finding us phone/text[masked] (but only after you've had a good look for the Chimay stand :)

It'll be quite a free form event, so meeting up will be a bit random. Our 'general' meeting point will be the Chimey stall at the market. I'll be at once an hour till 21.00. I only guarantee to wait there for 5 mins though in reality I will tend to hang around there at other times. There are several other stalls, etc that are of beer interest too. Of course, you can stroll by yourself until we catch up with each other or by yourself or in small sub-groups as desired.

The meeting point is Chimey Stall, which is nearer the top end of the market (maybe one third of the way down from the church?). It's on the left hand side of the stalls, looking at St Catherines Church thingy. There's tables with Chime parasols outside, so should be easy to find.

Phone me if you have any problem finding me (which you can do if you miss me at the 'On The Hour' meeting time too).

I took some photos in previous years. Album here: http://www.meetup.com/The-Brussels-Bar-Trek/photos/1178053/

There's plenty of food and drink of many types (plenty of hot mulled wine with added spirits - yum!)

Easiest way to et there is to go to St Catherines Metro station. Here's a map: http://tinyurl.com/btmw3df

From 21.00 we'll get into proper Bar Trek mode and go to a bar close to St Catherines: Kafka

Map: https://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&safe=off&q=kafka+brussels&ie=UTF-8&ei=rlpfUILELarV0QW-nYDIBQ&ved=0CAgQ_AUoAg

It's big but may well be busy. Who knows what seating availability may be like - We just take our chances, eh?

Find me at the Chimey Stall on the Hour (19.00, 20.00, 21.00) (or call 0486 [masked]). I'll wear a white sweatshirt thingy with cute Pandas on (well, except that they are carrying a pistol - Good will to all non-panda's & all that!) but somewhat covered by my a grey jacket and possibly a black woolly hat, since I expect it will be jolly cold!

Once we get to Kafka, I'll be wearing a black T-Shirt with "Beer" on the front in large friendly white letters

BTW - If you need warming up or it rains, head straight for Kafka

Note that I'm not putting a limit on numbers for this meetup. I've we end up with huge numbers then we'll just have to cross our fingers and meet up/get in bars as best we can (we can always overspill into the Coq, Cobra, etc). What can possibly go wrong!

Bah Humbug!

Pete
name: Bar Trek - St Catherines Christmas Market and Kafka

David

description:
Hello Bar Trekkers,

Another weekend, another Bar Trek!

Probably many of you are away for the Easter holiday this weekend, but I'm not so we'll do one anyway

We'll try a new bar this time: Cafe Roskam located near St Catherine. Actually this bar has been around for ages, but because of close proximity to the (late) Monk, we never got around to going there. Until now!

This is a lovely bar, with an excellent beer range (at modest prices to boot), and particularly popular with the Belgian (Flemish) locals. It doesn't do any food though, so you'll need to eat something beforehand.

Here is a nice review of the bar:
http://www.flanderstoday.eu/content/caf%C3%A9-spotlight-roskam

The address is Rue de Flandre 9, 1000 Brussels: http://tinyurl.com/ct3xpqo

I'll try to get some tables in the front of the bar. If you can't find us, please ask the bar staff, or call me at 0497/053166.

As from 22h-23h there will be a DJ set starting, so we might move to another bar at that point. Or we could just stay, as normally the music is quite good! As usual we'll just decide on the spot.

Hope to see you there!

David

description:
Dear Bar Trekkers,


This Saturday we shall be going to the Zythos Beer Festival (near Leuven) again. 300 beers!
The beer fest website is here: http://www.zbf.be/index.php?lang=UK&page=1

 

It runs from 12:00 on Saturday 27th April and in true Bar Trek fashion that's what we will be aiming for (well, almost) There's snacks available (fries, dörum, hamburgers,...) so we can keep nicely fed.
The meeting point will be at the beer festival itself. It's at the "Brabanthal" which we can get to using shuttle buses from Leuven Station.


I will be getting the 11.40 train from Brussels Central station (arriving Leuven 12.03). I encourage you to join me but of course you may travel at any time, in any manner you wish. Don't forget to allow for time to buy your ticket (not sure how much it costs). If you want to join me on the train - don't be late! Meet me on the platform the train goes from (whatever platform that turns out to be) at the end nearest the front of the train.

In fact, when RSVPing 'Yes' if you guess your likely turn up time that would be helpful (though not necessary)


No idea how long we'll stay - till 18:00 at least and possibly longer (but no guarantees past 18:00). As from 18:00 our friends from the Zumwol bar crawl meetup will arrive so we might hook up with them at some point.


Also, there's no easy way to work out a good meeting point at the festival itself, as I don't know in advance which table we'll be at. So you may just need to phone/text me (0497/053166) to find out where we are. It doesn't help that I have never been there myself I suggest meeting at the stand where you buy the beer tokens, as you'll have to be queuing there anyway. Just call me when you are there, and I'll come and get you.

 

Cost:Free entry (hooray!)

Beer: 1.40 euro per 15cl (paid via tokens)

Beer Glass: 3 euro (returnable deposit)

Toilet: 0.30 euro per visit, or 2€ for whole day

Festival guide: 0.50 euro


See you there,

David
name: Zythos Beer Festival - just outside Leuven

description:
Hi all,

In a brave departure for Bar Trek we shall be going to the Medieval market in Parc du Cinquantenaire (http://www.brusselslife.be/en/article/medieval-market-@-etterbeek). It'll be a bit of a 'make it up as we go along' sort of affair

Map: http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Parc+du+Cinquantenaire&oe=utf-8&rls=org.mozilla:en-GB:official&client=&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=X&ei=hh-SUbvJLsXYOr-CgMgF&ved=0CAsQ_AUoAg

General details: "The 21st edition of the medieval market will take place Friday 17th (from 6.00pm to 10.00pm), Saturday 18th (from 10.00am to 10.00pm) and Sunday 19th May (from 10.00am to 8.00pm). This event is already known beyond Brussels borders and will celebrate its 21st birthday this year. To celebrate, more than a hundred exhibitors will line their stalls along the Parc du Cinquantenaire. The event is free. "

I shall be there on Saturday from 14:00

***** Update: (Sat morning)

Weather is looking OK (ish) so drinking will be done

I popped along yesterday lunchtime when they were setting up. I seemed to me that the beer/food stall will be mostly towards the left hand side of Parc du Cinquantenaire (LHS walking away from city centre). So, that's the place to aim for initially.

My identifiable waistcoat will be my black and white 'dancing men' one - see below

 

 

I'll try and add a comment with exact location details once there. That should trigger an email too. Fingers crossed the technology works :)

************

This will be a pretty flexible Bar Trek. To be honest, I'm not even sure what beer, etc they do. I went a couple of years back and remember drinking…….but oddly not much else

I'm rather hoping for some mead but we shall see………

If you have trouble finding me, just have a walk about &/or text me at some point. Note that I suspect the chance of getting any seating is low.

I plan to stay for at least a couple of hours & possibly far longer. Things that will make me cut my time short are:

Rubbish/no beer or an acceptable alternative (Jupiler and Maes are not acceptable alternatives, wine/mead is) Raining cats and dogs It being a bit crap for some other undefined (but obvious once there) reason Any trouble finding me (which is quite likely), text[masked] 377. If you call I might pick up if I hear my phone (maybe)

Cheers

Pete

description:
OK Trekkers,

We are going to try an experiment

A common issue is that, due to bar size/barman availability I place a limit on the number of attendees. So, we thought we'd try something different to avoid that

Three of Bar Trek's favourite bars are within spitting distance of each other (Coq, Kafka and Cobra). So we are going to all three at the same time, using all three Organisers!

Your job will be to pick your starting bar and then stay there or wander to the other two as and when you feel like it. If you find your bar of choice is just too full, then move on to the next. So, we'll need your co-operation here a bit - What can possibly go wrong?

When you RSVP to this please also comment saying which bar you intend to start off in. Doesn't matter which - it's up to you. But if you can aim for about equal numbers in each that would be appreciated (i.e. make you best guess judging from previous RSVPs and their chosen first bar).

BTW - A quick count for each bar as of Monday morning: Cobra 12, Coq 11, Kafka 6, No choice yet 21. So, probably good if we can beef up Kafka attendance a bit. Don't forget to add it as a comment on this page.

No idea if this will work but it'll be fun finding out

Myself, David and Liz will start at one bar and move on on the hour. So, for us it's:

Pete: 20.00 Cobra, 21.00 Coq, 22.00 Kafka Liz: 20.00 Coq, 21.00 Kafka, 22.00 Cobra David: 20.00 Kafka, 21.00 Cobra, 22.00 Coq After 23.00 we just stumble about as we see fit

Details of the three bars (maps are linked to the bar name - just click on them):

Le Coq: This is a real locals bar with a good range of beers, all written on the large board at the back. I tend to hang out nearer the back, but we could end up anywhere. Kafka: Nice large bar with a decent range of beers (on the blackboard behind you as you stand at the bar) Cobra: Not a massive beer range (but a few trusty standard Trappists) but they take their cocktails quite seriously :) And super friendly bar staff No food at any of these so feed yourself beforehand.

For those new to Bar Trek (or those who can't remember what us Organisers look like) well be wearing something identifiable, as follows:

Pete: my blue Bar Trek T-shirt (it's blue and has "Bar Trek" written on it) David: His curly hair should be enough! Liz: Looking like Liz Mobile numbers if lost :

Pete: 0486 [masked] David:[masked] Liz:[masked] See you there (and there and there!)

Cheers

Pete, Liz, David
how_to_find_us: Use those maps (below) - Phone/Text me, Liz & David on numbers in the main event details
name: Bar Trek - MegaTrek! (Muilti-location - See details in main text)

description:
OK, It's along time since were here. Basically the music became less pop/rock and more dancey. But I've had several requests for a repeat and it's well worth a return


It's back to Le Corbreau (The Raven). This is a rather remarkable place where dancing on the tabletops at weekends is not only acceptable, but positively encouraged! It all seems to really kick off around 11.45 but it does vary.


Take a look here - www.lecorbeau.be/

Map (since I don't fully trust the Meetup ones): http://tinyurl.com/2urrect

It does good beer - in very tall 'Kwak'-like glasses (before the dancing gets underway). It does food earlier on but I wouldn't count on it. I'll be eating before I get there.

We shall meet there (print that map!). Phone/text me on[masked] (not a smartphone)

Be aware that the bar gets filled up quickly and it's impossible to book/save seats. So, it's up to you to get there early enough if you want to sit down. I went to try and book a table. Unless I could gaurentee X people by Y time, all eating they wouldn't let me. So, I repeat....get there early if you want a seat

As always, no thanks whatsoever to Meetup.com for taking away the 'RSVP' Maybe option - so if you can indicate you level of likelyhood of being there, please do.

For identification purposes, I shall be wearing a something identifiable - I think my dark green Dangermouse T-Shirt.

For the uninitiated, this is Dangermouse:


 

 

 

 

Cheers

Pete
how_to_find_us: We shall meet there (print that map!). I shall be wearing a green Dangermouse t-shirt -And/Or phone/text me on 0488 658 612

description:
Greetings Trekkers,

For this Bar Trek I'm going to indulge myself and do a crawl of some my favourite bars.

The plan is:

*[masked]: Moeder Lambic (the one in centre of Brussels NOT in St Giles): Excellent beer range. Friendly staff.
Address is: Place Fontainas 8, Brussels, Belgium 1000 (Map Here: http://tinyurl.com/7rvwplj)

* 21.30 - 22.45- Booze N Blues: It's cosy and feels like a Blues bar. There's a jukebox that's works & other odd nic-naks. Map: http://tinyurl.com/3exkfrv
(Booze N Blues is quite small. If it's busy we will use the Java bar as a 'spill over' venue. The Java bar is directly (diagonally) across from Booze N Blues. Beers not as good but they do have a wacky bar top surface!)

After the sucess of Megatrek a couple of weeks ago, we're doing it again

Three of Bar Trek's favourite bars are within spitting distance of each other (Bizon, Kafka and Cobra). So we are going to all three at the same time, using all three Organisers!

Your job will be to pick your starting bar and then stay there or wander to the other two as and when you feel like it. If you find your bar of choice is just too full, then move on to the next. So, we'll need your co-operation here a bit

When you RSVP to this please also comment saying which bar you intend to start off in. Doesn't matter which - it's up to you. But if you can aim for about equal numbers in each that would be appreciated (i.e. make you best guess judging from previous comments and their chosen first bar).

Liz: 20.00 Cobra, 21.00 Bizon, 22.00 Kafka Daivid: 20.00 Bizon, 21.00 Kafka, 22.00 Cobra Pete: 20.00 Kafka, 21.00 Cobra, 22.00 Bizon After 23.00 we just stumble about as we see fit

Details of the three bars (maps are linked to the bar name - just click on them):

Bizon: Excellent quirky bar. Nice balcony bit. Website here: http://www.cafebizon.com/index.htm Kafka: Nice large bar with a decent range of beers (on the blackboard behind you as you stand at the bar) Cobra: Not a massive beer range (but a few trusty standard Trappists) but they take their cocktails quite seriously :) And super friendly bar staff No food at any of these so feed yourself beforehand.

As it only opened again recently, it might be quite busy so who knows how easily we will find spots to sit in. I'm not expecting problems, but we shall see.....

BTW - When I went they had the much sought after beer - Trappist Westvleteren 12 (XII) - for 8.95 Euros , which is as cheap as I've ever seen it in a bar.  Still damn expensive though. No idea if it'll be available when we go.

There's a buffet room in the back now (where the smoking room used to be), where you can get some pasta dishes before the bar trek if you want, or until 11pm.

My mobile number will be: 0497/053166 - Give me a shout on that if you're lost (after checking your map that you printed out, didn't you?........) or can't see us in the bar.

Cheers

David

description:
Please read below carefully, as there are some changes regarding logistics compared to previous years!


Dear Bar Trekkers,

Next Weekend is the Brussels Beer Festival in Grand Place. Clearly, Bar Trek needs a presence - We shall go there on Saturday (7th). It takes up the whole of Grand Place, so you can't miss it

Here's the home page for the fest: http://www.belgianbrewers.be/en/events/belgian-beer-weekend-171/

It gets very busy and the best time to go is at the start of the session (hence 11.00am start for me).

Like last year, the plan is to stay until 2pm ish and then review things - I suspect, if still standing, the professional drinkers will move elsewhere (nearby but not so close that we run into other fest escapees)

Clearly, meeting up will be tricky. I'll keep an eye/ear out for calls and texts (0497/053166).

We shall aim to meet at the bottom left corner (please refer to the map below), around stands 30 to 33 & just try to get together as best we can.

We buy beer tokens (plus one for the glass deposit too!) first, then swap those for beer after. There are separate pay desks for those (€ symbols on the map below). Apparently you have to buy 10 beer tokens as a minimum (was this always like that?). Depending on the beers you get this is about 4 beers. Probably some of you don't intend to drink that much, so my plan is to buy a bigger quantitiy of beer and glass tokens in advance, which you can then get from me, in case you only intend to drink a few beers. When those run out, I suggest you pair up with somebody else, and 1 person gets the tokens. In any case, please check in with the group first, before going to the pay desks! That way we can avoid that everyone is buying too many tokens. Let's see how it goes... Furthermore, it seems the pay desks will be open for some time already on Thursday and Friday, so probably will be less queues then.


Weather forecast looks ok-ish at the moment, will keep an eye on it and update as needed.


Cheers, David

The Map:
how_to_find_us: Bottom left corner of Grand Place (refer to map below), between stand 30-33. If you can't find us, call me on 0497/053166.
name: Saturday at Brussels Beer Fest in Grand Place

description:
Please read the below carefully, as this will a bit different from a regular bar trek!

Dear Bar Trekkers,

This week Oktoberfest touches down again in Brussels!

While not as elaborate as the real one in Munich, it's still a lot of good fun, so clearly bar trek needs a presence! Expect lots of lederhosen, humptata music and of course plenty of beer distributed non-stop by the numerous beer maids! Also plenty of German food and snacks available.

The first few days are already fully booked, so I put our visit on Sunday evening. As closing time is already at 22h30, this should be no problem for the next day, right ;-) Please note that the start time for the bar trek is already 18h. 

This is where things get a bit tricky. I have booked 3 tables, so space for 24 people, and this is pretty strict! The organisation will not allow people to stay if they don't have a space at a table. Being Sunday night there might be some unbooked tables, but I can't guarantee that! So I recommend you only show up if you have RSVPd Yes. Otherwise it's likely you won't have a space. Furthermore they expect people to arrive between 18h and 19h. After that I think that the organizers are free to give the untaken spaces away! SO if you can't make the 18h-19h timeframe, please do not RSVP, as your space will probably not be available anymore afterwards.

Here's a map to the venue: http://tinyurl.com/3flod83  Big tent on place Jourdan, you can't miss it really. The tables are booked under my name: David Van den Bunder. 

As always phone/text me at 0497/053166 in case you can't find us.

See you there,

David
how_to_find_us: Meet inside the Oktoberfest Tent - Table marked David Van den Bunder. And/Or phone/text me on 0497/053166
