description:
Merry Chrimbo all, Time to get into the Yuletide spirit!

The Christmas market at St Catherines has a lot of food and drink stalls (as well as plenty of xmas pressie type stalls). There's also an ice rink and big wheel for those who are inclined.

We'll start quite early (19.00) to allow for tourist avoidance strategies, but feel free to turn up any time before (or after!) 21.00. If you have trouble finding us phone/text[masked] (but only after you've had a good look for the Chimay stand :)

It'll be quite a free form event, so meeting up will be a bit random. Our 'general' meeting point will be the Chimay Beer stall at the market. I'll be at once an hour till 21.00. I only guarantee to wait there for 5 mins though in reality we will tend to hang around there at other times. There are several other stalls, etc that are of beer interest too. Of course, you can stroll by yourself until we catch up with each other or by yourself or in small sub-groups as desired.

The meeting point is the Chimay Beer Stall. With the church at your back and walking in the direction of the Big Wheel/Ice Rink, the Chimay stand is on the right side where the larger "street" narrows a bit. It has a big red Chimay sign on top and is opposite the big Vandonghen Car (Waffles and Croustillons).  

Phone if you have any problem finding us (which you can do if you miss me at the 'On The Hour' meeting time too)-  [masked] 

I took some photos in previous years. Album here: http://www.meetup.com/The-Brussels-Bar-Trek/photos/1178053/

There's plenty of food and drink of many types (plenty of hot mulled wine with added spirits - yum!)

Easiest way to et there is to go to St Catherines Metro station. Here's a map: http://tinyurl.com/btmw3df

From 21.00 we'll get into proper Bar Trek mode and go to a bar close to St Catherines: Kafka

Map: https://maps.google.co.uk/maps?hl=en&safe=off&q=kafka+brussels&ie=UTF-8&ei=rlpfUILELarV0QW-nYDIBQ&ved=0CAgQ_AUoAg

It's big but may well be busy. Who knows what seating availability may be like - We just take our chances, eh?

Find us at the Chimay Stall on the Hour (19.00, 20.00, 21.00) 

BTW - If you need warming up or it rains, head straight for Kafka


As usual, for the newcomers who cant find us:


Pete  [masked] I'll be wearing a white sweatshirt with gun toting pandas on, like this (though probably with leather jacket on top too - so, approach me from the front :):

And David's number too:  [masked]


Cheers


Pete
name: Bar Trek - St Catherines Christmas Market and Kafka

description:
Dear Bar Trekkers,

Not sure how many of you are already on holiday, but I'm not so why not another bar trek this Friday!

Let's start things of at Monk:

Address:  Rue Saint-Catherine,42  -  Map: http://tinyurl.com/37owz3v)

The bar has changed a bit from its previous incarnation. More foody and less beery (boo hiss!). But still a decent beer range and plenty of space. More info on www.monk.be


As it only opened again a few months ago, it might be quite busy so who knows how easily we will find spots to sit in. Not possible to reserve spaces in advance I'm afraid, but should be fine!


There's a buffet room in the back now (where the smoking room used to be), where you can get some pasta dishes before or during the bar trek if you want.

Then around 22h I plan to move on to Roskam, which is just across the street basically. This timing is very flexible really, and depends how much we are enjoying ourselves at Monk. So if you can't find us at Monk, just head over to Roskam!


This is a lovely bar, with an excellent beer range (at modest prices to boot), and particularly popular with the Belgian (Flemish) locals.


Here is a nice review of the bar:
http://www.flanderstoday.eu/content/caf%C3%A9-spotlight-roskam

The address is Rue de Flandre 9, 1000 Brussels: http://tinyurl.com/ct3xpqo

At some point there might be a DJ set starting, so we could move to another bar then. Or we could just stay, as normally the music is quite good! As usual we'll just decide on the spot.

description:
Hello all of you fellow bar trekkies!

This week’s bar trek started out as a very late night idea at a Cobra bar trek last year. Obviously, we had everything planned out while being in a festive mood and then never got around to doing this. But now we set a date and it will go through, come what may.

This week we will be exploring the bars flying the rainbow flag, aka the small yet lively Brussels offer of gay bars. Therefore, no selection of bars based on a fine offer of beers, but the usual suspects will be readily available. This is still Belgium, and don’t you forget it!

We will have a small choice of 2 bars, with an after trek special for those of you up for more fun.

20:00 Meeting point will be at Café Fontainas (Kolenmarkt 91) on the terrace if the weather allows it and inside if winter’s back. So let’s all hope for good weather as this is one of the nicest terraces in Brussels. They even have some food so if you’re feeling peckish…

Then we’ll move on a couple of steps to Le Belgica (Kolenmarkt 32) at about 21:30-22:00: A dive joint built around the remains of a 1920's bar, yes it's that old, and transformed into a grunge bar before becoming a gay bar in 1994. Everywhere you will find reminders of the Belgian Monarchy. The bronze bust of Leopold II sits nobly above the public still enjoying the victory over his kidnappers. Leopold II has always been a heavyweight.

And if this is not enough for one evening for you hardcore trekkies we can then move on to a 3rd bar. For those still not ready to end the evening, from 1 am onwards fabulous drag queen shows can be enjoyed at Chez Maman

Some details:

Due to the relative size of the bars, this bar trek will be small. Please be accurate with your RSVPs and sign out if you can’t make it.

Please be respectful of the space and people. Gay bars are places where members of the LGBT community can hang out without having to deal with homophobia.

Nearest metro stations are Bourse and Brouckere

If you get lost give me a call/text on[masked] and I'll try to guide you/tell you where we are.

Cheers,

Sabine
how_to_find_us: TBC
name: Rainbow Bar Trek

description:
Dear Bar Trekkers,


This Sunday we shall be going to the Zythos Beer Festival (near Leuven) again. 500+ beers!
The beer fest website is here: http://www.zbf.be/index.php?lang=UK&page=1

 

It runs from 11:00 on Sunday 27th April and in true Bar Trek fashion (and to avoid the big crowds) that's what we will be aiming for (well, almost) There's snacks available (fries, dörum, hamburgers,...) so we can keep nicely fed.

The meeting point will be at the beer festival itself. It's at the "Brabanthal" which we can get to using shuttle buses from Leuven Station.

I will be getting the 10:40 train from Brussels Central station (arriving Leuven 11:03), so arriving at the Brabanthal 15-20 minutes after that. I encourage you to join me but of course you may travel at any time, in any manner you wish. Don't forget to allow for time to buy your ticket (make sure to ask for the weekend reduction). If you want to join me on the train - don't be late! Meet me on the platform the train goes from (whatever platform that turns out to be) at the end nearest the front of the train.

In fact, when RSVPing 'Yes' if you guess your likely turn up time that would be helpful (though not necessary)


No idea how long we'll stay - till 16:00 at least and possibly longer. But sure to call me in advance if you intend to turn up later in the afternoon, to make sure we are still there.

Also, there's no easy way to work out a good meeting point at the festival itself, as I don't know in advance which table we'll be at. So you may just need to phone/text me (0497/053166) to find out where we are. I suggest meeting at the stand where you buy the beer tokens, as you'll have to be queuing there anyway. Just call me when you are there, and I'll come and get you.

Cost:Free entry (hooray!)

Beer: 1.50 euro per 15cl (paid via tokens)

Beer Glass: 3 euro (returnable deposit)

Toilet: 1,5€ for whole day

Festival guide: 0.50 euro

A change from previous years, is that now they are offering a "starter pack": 10€ for 5 tokens and a glass, avoiding the need to queue twice like before (once for tokens, once for glass). You'll still need to get additional tokens separately afterwards, in case you need more.

See you there,

David
name: Zythos Beer Festival - just outside Leuven

So I am proposing to meet this Saturday at 8pm at the Flamingo for the beginning of the evening and from there move on to the Café Bizon to finish the evening in style.

The Flamingo is still Brussels biggest bar and has a nice selection of beers as well as an interestingly adventurous waiting staff (we counted at least 7 dropped trays full of empty glasses the last time). Possibility to have a bit of food for the famished, but let’s concentrate on the drinks.

description:
Hello there, fellow bar trekkers,

It is time again to choose an interesting bar for a nice night out and about the town. This time the choice falls on the Walvis.

The Walvis is one of those somewhat stylish Flemish bars in the Dansaert area of Brussels. The clientele is mixed, a bit artsy, which goes with the district; the beer selection is not vast, but as a plus there are no TVs, so world cup tired people can enjoy a night without the ball that rules the world (until Sunday night at least). Another plus, there is a nice terrace so we might be able to enjoy a bit of summer breeze if the Brussels weather delivers. It just reopened 2 weeks ago with new management after being closed for half a year. Unfortunately, being all newly reopened they have not yet managed to have a functioning website.

Timing as always at 8pm and we might move to another bar later during the evening, but not before 22h at least. As usual, we'll just decide on the spot.

The address is Antoine Dansaertstraat 209, 1000 Brussels. Here is the google maps link https://www.google.com/maps/place/Rue+Antoine+Dansaert+209/@50.8528938,4.3419113,18z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x47c3c389491e5481:0x9af690e473988579

Closest metro station : Comte de Flandres / Graaf van Vlaanderen (lines 1 and 5) on the other side of the canal, just 5 min walking distance

Closest tram station : Porte de Flandres / Vlaamse Poort (line 51) just opposite side of the road

If lost, you can reach me on my phone[masked] and I will attempt to guide you if you can succesfully communicate where you are.

Hope to see you there

description:
Hello fellow Bar Trekkers,

For this week’s Bar Trek we'll return to an old favourite - Het Goudblommeke in Papier. Maybe, and this might be my own personal opinion, but whatevah… - the prettiest and nicest old pub in Brussels. This was the hot meeting spot for René Magritte and his surrealist friends, so we will honour our artistic Trekkers of ye olden times and enjoy the great beer and the even greater company.

For those unfamiliar with this pub (and you shouldn’t be), here is their website http://www.goudblommekeinpapier.be/nl/caf%C3%A9 (Flemish or French, your choice) and google maps https://www.google.be/maps/place/La+Fleur+en+Papier+Dor%C3%A9+%2F+Het+Goudblommeke+in+Papier/@50.842847,4.350693,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x47c3c479586d2943:0xc3a99b039d0d3521?hl=en

You will find us at the back of the pub, aka the modern annex, but with a small terrace for the smokers, so something for everybody.

Please buy your drinks “as you go” from the bar or in small groups. I want to avoid a huge bill at the end with people trying to remember what they had.

Then, between 10 to 11pm we’ll walk just a few doors up the street and some steps down the stairs to the vaulted cellars of Porte Noire, with their amazing beer and whiskey collection. Porte Noire has an English website http://www.laportenoire.be/about.php and the map says “a few doors up the street from Goudblommeke!”

If you can’t find us, here is my phone number[masked], and I will attempt to be your GPS, but no promises.

See you there,

Sabine

Well it’s this time of the year again, where people dress up in weird costumes, eat tons of sweets and drink lots of fine beer. The “Trek or Treat Bar Trek” has been a tradition that we have chosen to interrupt this year for personal reasons. Therefore, we will be meeting and enjoying good Belgian beers a day after the Orange and Black craziness of Halloween.

Bar Trek will start at 8pm at the first bar of the evening, the Booze ‘n Blues. Small venue, decent beer selection and a juke box for you Blues lovers. The address is Rue des Riches Claires 20, no website (it’s not that kind of pub) but here is the location on google maps https://www.google.be/maps/place/Rue+des+Riches+Claires+20,+1000+Bruxelles/@50.8467809,4.346964,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x47c3c478180ecce9:0x52e2e39ccadabad8?hl=en
